API_Description: Replaces pages in the current PDF document with pages from another document.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'replacePages' suggests functionality related to replacing existing pages in a document with pages from another source.
Returns: A boolean indicating success or failure of the page replacement operation.
Returns_Reason: Typically, methods that perform operations like replacing pages return a boolean to indicate whether the operation was successful.

nStart.description: The 0-based index of the first page to replace in the current document.
nStart.description_reason: Replacing pages usually requires specifying the starting page index in the current document.
nStart.type_reason: Page indices are typically represented as numbers.

nEnd.description: The 0-based index of the last page to replace in the current document.
nEnd.description_reason: To define a range of pages to replace, an end index is needed.
nEnd.type_reason: Page indices are typically represented as numbers.

cPath.description: The file path of the document from which pages will be sourced.
cPath.description_reason: To replace pages, the method needs to know the source document path.
cPath.type_reason: File paths are typically represented as strings.

nSourceStart.description: The 0-based index of the first page to use from the source document.
nSourceStart.description_reason: Specifying the starting page in the source document is necessary for the replacement.
nSourceStart.type_reason: Page indices are typically represented as numbers.

nSourceEnd.description: The 0-based index of the last page to use from the source document.
nSourceEnd.description_reason: To define a range of pages from the source document, an end index is needed.
nSourceEnd.type_reason: Page indices are typically represented as numbers.
